src.frog package

Submodules

src.frog.classic_algorithms_frog module

class src.frog.classic_algorithms_frog.COPRA(delay, frequency, measured_trace, nonlinear_method, cross_correlation=False, **kwargs)

Bases: COPRABASE, RetrievePulsesFROG

The Common Pulse Retrieval Algorithm (COPRA) for FROG. Inherits from COPRABASE and RetrievePulsesFROG.

get_Z_gradient_individual(signal_t, signal_t_new, population, tau_arr, measurement_info, pulse_or_gate)

Calculates the Z-error gradient for an individual.

get_Z_newton_direction(grad, signal_t, signal_t_new, tau_arr, population, local_or_global_state, measurement_info, descent_info, full_or_diagonal, pulse_or_gate)

Calculates the Z-error newton direction for a population.

update_individual(individual, gamma, descent_direction, measurement_info, descent_info, pulse_or_gate)

Updates an individual based on a descent direction and a step size.

class src.frog.classic_algorithms_frog.CPCGPA(delay, frequency, trace, nonlinear_method, cross_correlation=False, **kwargs)

Bases: ClassicAlgorithmsBASE, RetrievePulsesFROG

The Constrained-PCGP-Algorithms. Inherits from ClassicAlgorithmsBASE and RetrievePulsesFROG.

    1. Kane and A. B. Vakhtin, Prog. Quantum Electron. 81 (100364), 10.1016/j.pquantelec.2021.100364 (2022)

constraints

bool, if true the operator based constraints are used.

svd

bool, if true a full SVD is performed instead of a single iteration of the power method

antialias

bool, if true anti-aliasing is applied to the outer-product-matrix-form

calculate_opf(pulse_t, gate, pulse_t_prime, gate_prime, iteration, nonlinear_method, measurement_info)

Calculates the opf given a pulse and gate.

calculate_signal_t_using_opf(individual, iteration, measurement_info, descent_info)

Calculates signal_t for and individual via the opf.

convert_opf_to_signal_t(opf, idx_arr)

Transforms opf to signal field, by shifting along the time axis. Switching and flipping the two halfs around.

convert_signal_t_to_opf(signal_t, idx_arr)

Converts a signal field into an opf by reversing the operations from convert_opf_to_signal_t().

decompose_opf(opf, pulse_t, gate, measurement_info, descent_info)

Decomposes the opf into its dominant components via an SVD or the Power-Method.

do_anti_alias(opf, half_N)

Performs anti-aliasing to the opf by setting a lower and upper an triangle to zero.

impose_constraints(pulse_t, gate, opf, measurement_info)

Applies additional constraints according to the operator formalism of PCGP.

initialize_run(population)

Prepares all provided data and parameters for the reconstruction. Here the final shape/structure of descent_state, measurement_info and descent_info are determined.

Parameters:

population – Pytree, the initial guess as created by self.create_initial_population()

Returns:

tuple[Pytree, Callable], the initial descent state and the step-function of the algorithm.

post_process_create_trace(individual)

For PCGP the trace is constructed using the opf.

shift_rows(row, idx)

Vectorized version of shift_rows. Takes similar arguments as shift_rows but with additional array axes over which shift_rows is mapped.

step(descent_state, measurement_info, descent_info)

Performs one iteration of the C-PCGP Algorithm.

Parameters:

  • descent_state – Pytree,

  • measurement_info – Pytree,

  • descent_info – Pytree,

Returns:

tuple[Pytree, jnp.array], the updated descent state and the current errors

update_individual(opf, individual, measurement_info, descent_info)

Updates and individual using an updated opf.

class src.frog.classic_algorithms_frog.GeneralizedProjection(delay, frequency, measured_trace, nonlinear_method, cross_correlation=False, **kwargs)

Bases: GeneralizedProjectionBASE, RetrievePulsesFROG

The Generalized Projection Algorithm for FROG. Inherits from GeneralizedProjectionBASE and RetrievePulsesFROG.

calculate_Z_gradient_individual(signal_t, signal_t_new, population, tau_arr, measurement_info, pulse_or_gate)

Calculates the Z-error gradient for an individual.

calculate_Z_newton_direction(grad, signal_t_new, signal_t, tau_arr, descent_state, measurement_info, descent_info, full_or_diagonal, pulse_or_gate)

Calculates the Z-error newton direction for a population.

update_individual(individual, gamma, descent_direction, measurement_info, pulse_or_gate)

Updates an individual based on a descent_direction and step size.

class src.frog.classic_algorithms_frog.LSGPA(delay, frequency, measured_trace, nonlinear_method, cross_correlation=False, **kwargs)

Bases: Vanilla

The Least-Squares Generalized Projection Algorithm. Inherits from Vanilla.

  1. Gagnon et al., Appl. Phys. B 92, 25-32, 10.1007/s00340-008-3063-x (2008)

update_gate(gate, signal_t_new, pulse_t_shifted, measurement_info, descent_info)

Generates an new (maybe improoved) guess for the gate.

update_pulse(pulse, signal_t_new, gate_shifted, measurement_info, descent_info)

Generates an new (maybe improoved) guess for the pulse.

class src.frog.classic_algorithms_frog.PtychographicIterativeEngine(delay, frequency, measured_trace, nonlinear_method, pie_method='rPIE', cross_correlation=False, **kwargs)

Bases: PtychographicIterativeEngineBASE, RetrievePulsesFROG

The Ptychographic Iterative Engine (PIE) for FROG. Inherits from PtychographicIterativeEngineBASE and RetrievePulsesFROG.

pie_method

None or str, specifies the PIE variant. Can be one of None, PIE, ePIE, rPIE.

calculate_PIE_descent_direction_m(signal_t, signal_t_new, tau, population, pie_method, measurement_info, descent_info, pulse_or_gate)

Calculates the PIE direction for pulse or gate-pulse for a given shift.

calculate_PIE_newton_direction(grad, signal_t, tau_arr, measured_trace, population, local_or_global_state, measurement_info, descent_info, pulse_or_gate, local_or_global)

Calculates the newton direction for a population.

get_gate_probe_for_hessian(pulse_t, gate_pulse_shifted, nonlinear_method)

For the reconstruction of the gate pulse, the probe depends on the nonlinear method for the hessian calculation.

modify_grad_for_gate_pulse(grad_all_m, gate_pulse_shifted, nonlinear_method)

For reconstruction of the gate-pulse the gradient depends on the nonlinear method.

reverse_transform_grad(signal, tau_arr, measurement_info)

For reconstruction of the gate-pulse the shift has to be undone.

update_individual(individual, gamma, descent_direction, measurement_info, pulse_or_gate)

Updates an individual based on a descent direction and step size.

class src.frog.classic_algorithms_frog.Vanilla(delay, frequency, measured_trace, nonlinear_method, cross_correlation=False, **kwargs)

Bases: ClassicAlgorithmsBASE, RetrievePulsesFROG

The Vanilla-FROG Algorithm as described by R. Trebino. Inherits from ClassicAlgorithmsBASE and RetrievePulsesFROG.

  1. Trebino, “Frequency-Resolved Optical Gating: The Measurement of Ultrashort Laser Pulses”, 10.1007/978-1-4615-1181-6 (2000)

initialize_run(population)

Prepares all provided data and parameters for the reconstruction. Here the final shape/structure of descent_state, measurement_info and descent_info are determined.

Parameters:

population – Pytree, the initial guess as created by self.create_initial_population()

Returns:

tuple[Pytree, Callable], the initial descent state and the step-function of the algorithm.

step(descent_state, measurement_info, descent_info)

Performs one iteration of the Vanilla Algorithm.

Parameters:

  • descent_state – Pytree,

  • measurement_info – Pytree,

  • descent_info – Pytree,

Returns:

tuple[Pytree, jnp.array], the updated descent state and the current errors

update_gate(gate, signal_t_new, pulse_t_shifted, measurement_info, descent_info)

Generates an new (maybe improoved) guess for the gate.

update_pulse(pulse, signal_t_new, gate_shifted, measurement_info, descent_info)

Generates an new (maybe improoved) guess for the pulse.

src.frog.general_algorithms_frog module

class src.frog.general_algorithms_frog.AutoDiff(delay, frequency, measured_trace, nonlinear_method, cross_correlation=False, **kwargs)

Bases: AutoDiffBASE, RetrievePulsesFROG

The Optimistix package utilized for pulse reconstruction from FROG. Inherits from AutoDiffBASE and RetrievePulsesFROG.

get_pulses_from_population(population, measurement_info, descent_info)
make_pulse_from_individual(individual, measurement_info, descent_info, pulse_or_gate)

Evaluates a pulse/gate for an individual.

class src.frog.general_algorithms_frog.DifferentialEvolution(delay, frequency, measured_trace, nonlinear_method, cross_correlation=False, **kwargs)

Bases: DifferentialEvolutionBASE, RetrievePulsesFROG

The Differential Evolution Algorithm applied to FROG. Inherits from DifferentialEvolutionBASE and RetrievePulsesFROG.

get_pulses_from_population(population, measurement_info, descent_info)

Calls get_pulses_t_from_population()

class src.frog.general_algorithms_frog.Evosax(delay, frequency, measured_trace, nonlinear_method, cross_correlation=False, **kwargs)

Bases: EvosaxBASE, RetrievePulsesFROG

The Evosax package utilized for pulse reconstruction from FROG. Inherits from EvosaxBASE and RetrievePulsesFROG.

get_pulses_from_population(population, measurement_info, descent_info)

Calls get_pulses_t_from_population()

class src.frog.general_algorithms_frog.LSF(delay, frequency, measured_trace, nonlinear_method, cross_correlation=False, **kwargs)

Bases: LSFBASE, RetrievePulsesFROG

The LSF Algorithm applied to FROG. Inherits from LSFBASE and RetrievePulsesFROG.

convert_population(population, measurement_info, descent_info)

Converts any population into a discretized one.

get_pulses_from_population(population, measurement_info, descent_info)

Returns the pulse and gate population. Does not need to call get_pulses_t_from_population() since LSF works with discetized fields only.
